p: In vivo antiplasmodial results of different plant extracts assayed against P. berghei in mice on day four postinfection (pi) and their corresponding survival time in days are summarized in Table 3. Suppression of parasitemia was used as a measure of antiplasmodial activity and was interpreted as follows: highly active (>60%), moderately active (30-60%), lowly active (10-30%), and no activity (<10) [ 20]. Overall, none of the extracts exhibited high parasitemia suppression > 60%. However, 18% of the extracts exhibited moderate antiplasmodial activity and 39% exhibited low activity while 42% were inactive ( Table 3).
